TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Fine, mixed, superactive Typic Cryaquolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Crubas clay loam - meadow.  (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise noted.)
0--3 inches to 0; partly decomposed organic matter.
A--0 to 12 inches; dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) clay loam, very dark brown (10YR 2/2) moist; common medium distinct strong brown (7.5YR 5/8) mottles; weak fine granular structure; soft, very friable, sticky and plastic; many fine and very fine roots; common fine and very fine interstitial pores; strongly acid; abrupt smooth boundary.  (7 to 14 inches thick)
Cg1--12 to 34 inches; light gray (10YR 6/1) clay, gray (10YR 5/1) moist; common medium distinct strong brown (7.5YR 5/8) mottles; massive; very hard, firm, very sticky and very plastic; few fine and very fine roots; few fine and common very fine tubular pores; strongly acid; clear wavy boundary.  (18 to 40 inches thick)
2Cg2--34 to 60 inches; light gray (10YR 6/1) gravelly clay, gray (10YR 5/1) moist; many large distinct strong brown (7.5YR 5/8) mottles; massive; hard, firm, very sticky and very plastic; few very fine roots; few very fine tubular pores; 20 percent pebbles; strongly acid.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Rio Arriba County, New Mexico; approximately 13 miles east and 4 miles south of Chama, NM.  State plane coordinates 2,127,490 feet north and 440,625 feet east; 106 degrees, 27 minutes, 08 seconds west longitude; 36 degrees, 51 minutes, 19 seconds north latitude.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Soil Moisture:  This soil is saturated in winter, spring and early summer.
Annual Soil Temperature:  37 to 39 degrees F.
Summer Soil Temperature:  39 to 43 degrees F.
Reaction:  Slightly acid to strongly acid.
Depth to Mottles:  0 to 6 inches.
Thickness of mollic epipedon:  7 to 14 inches.
Depth to water table:  Near the surface to 20 inches.
Particle-size control section:  35 to 50 percent clay.
A horizon - Value:  2 or 3 moist.
Cg horizon - Value:  5 or 6 dry. Chroma:  1 or 2.
2Cg horizon - Value:  5 or 6 dry. Chroma:  1 or 2. Coarse fragments:  15 to 30 percent pebbles.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  There are no competing series at this time.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Crubas soils formed in alluvium from metamorphic rock on valley bottoms and swales.  This soil is associated with seeps and springs.  Slopes range from 0 to 5 percent.  The mean annual precipitation is 30 to 35 inches and the mean annual temperature is 35 to 37 degrees F.  Elevation ranges from 9,600 to 10,400 feet and the frost-free period is 50 to 70 days.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are Bywell and Croftshaw soils.  Bywell soils have more than 35 percent rock fragments. Croftshaw soils have less than 35 percent clay.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Poorly drained; slow runoff; slow permeability; watertable 0 to 20 inches; and floods occasionally.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Crubas soils are used for livestock grazing and wildlife habitat.  The present vegetation is bluegrass, sedges, rushes, alpine timothy, shrubby cinquefoil, clover and tufted hairgrass.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  North-central New Mexico.  Series is of small extent.
